recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs
steps: Crack eggs into a bowl and whisk until smooth.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
Pour eggs into the pan and stir gently until curds form.
Remove from heat while slightly runny; season with salt and pepper.
clarifications: Tip: Whisk until the yolks and whites are fully combined.
Tip: Use medium heat so the butter doesnâ€™t burn.
Tip: Stir slowly for soft curds instead of dry eggs.
Tip: Remove slightly early; eggs will keep cooking off heat.

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese
steps: Butter one side of two slices of bread.
Place cheese between the slices, buttered side out.
Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted.
clarifications: Tip: Use room-temperature butter for easier spreading.
Tip: Cheddar or American cheese melts best.
Tip: Press lightly with a spatula for even browning.
Tip: Lower heat if bread browns too fast.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Sandwich
steps: Lay two slices of bread on a plate.
Spread peanut butter on one slice of bread.
Spread jelly on the other slice of bread if desired.
Press the slices together and cut in half.
clarifications: Tip: Use smooth peanut butter for easier spreading.
Tip: Strawberry or grape jelly are classic choices.
Tip: A butter knife works best for spreading evenly.
Tip: Cutting diagonally makes it easier to eat.

recipes.title: Oatmeal
steps: Bring water or milk to a boil in a small pot.
Add oats and reduce heat to medium.
Cook while stirring occasionally until thick and creamy.
Serve hot and add toppings of your choice.
clarifications: Tip: Use a 2-to-1 ratio of liquid to oats for creamier texture.
Tip: Stir frequently to prevent sticking.
Tip: Instant oats cook faster but are softer in texture.
Tip: Common toppings include fruit, nuts, and honey.

recipes.title: Fruit Salad
steps: Wash all fruits thoroughly under running water.
Cut fruits into bite-sized pieces and place in a bowl.
Mix fruits gently with a spoon.
Optional: Add a drizzle of honey or squeeze of lemon juice.
clarifications: Tip: Use at least three types of fruit for variety.
Tip: Removing seeds makes the salad easier to eat.
Tip: A splash of lemon juice keeps fruits from browning.
Tip: Chill before serving for better taste.

recipes.title: Pasta with Tomato Sauce
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
Add pasta and cook until tender, stirring occasionally.
Drain pasta and return to the pot.
Pour tomato sauce over pasta and mix well before serving.
clarifications: Tip: Use about 1 teaspoon of salt per quart of water.
Tip: Stir pasta in the first minute to prevent sticking.
Tip: Save a little pasta water to thin the sauce if needed.
Tip: Top with grated cheese for extra flavor.
